intro: Vitex fischeri var. keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan chaste tree, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and local communities.
